explanation: The report is not correct for the code as presented. The potential out‑of‑bounds read described by agent A would only occur if the source string (var_name) could be non‑NUL terminated or longer than the destination buffer. In this code OS_CHECK_APINAME(var_name) is invoked before OS_OBJECT_INIT; that macro expands to OS_CHECK_STRING(var_name, OS_MAX_API_NAME, ...), i.e. it enforces the API name length / termination constraint (ensuring a NUL within OS_MAX_API_NAME bytes). The destination buffer is OS_condvar_internal_record_t.obj_name which is declared as char obj_name[OS_MAX_API_NAME]; OS_OBJECT_INIT uses strncpy(ref->obj_name, nameval, sizeof(ref->obj_name)-1) so the maximum copy length matches the check, and the prior memset/size-1 convention guarantees a NUL-terminated destination. Given the provided macro/definitions, the precondition required by MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 (that the source has a NUL within the checked bound) is satisfied, so there is no rule violation. (If OS_CHECK_STRING did not actually verify termination/length, then a violation would be possible, but that is not the case in the supplied code.)
